revised_title: Microwave Interferometry for Observing Detonation in Solid Explosives
tldr: The authors developed a method using microwave interferometry to observe the detonation front in solid explosives. They utilized the explosives as waveguide filling, taking advantage of their low-loss dielectric properties in the centimetric spectrum. This method provided high-resolution distance measurements of the detonation front, contributing to the understanding of how detonation starts and grows through its transient condition to steady high-order detonation.
